content.question: A satellite of mass <math alttext="120 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is in circular orbit at a height <math alttext="h equals R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the surface of Earth, where <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the radius of Earth. The radius and mass of Earth are <math alttext="6.4 times 10 to the 6 power meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6.4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="6.0 times 10 to the 24 power kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. The gravitational potential energy of the satellite-Earth system is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 1.51 times 10 to the 10 power joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.51</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 3.75 times 10 to the 9 power joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3.75</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.75 times 10 to the 9 power joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.75</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>J</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
